Article
Full-text available
  • Jan 2018
  • Lea Kohn
  • Thomas Gregor
  • Juraj Paule
  • Georg Zizka
Hexaploid Chenopodium album is common in Frankfurt/Main (Hesse). Plants differ in blooming time, height, branching pattern, leaf shape and inflorescence morphology. Morphologically similar plants often grow together. Characteristics vary independently of each other and it is inappropriate to recognize them as taxonomic units.

  • Georg Zizka
We present a new online database of chromosome counts and flow cytometric ploidy estimations of the flora of Germany with a detailed documentation of literature sources, examined material and sampling locations. For best compatibility with other botanical resources of Germany we use the ‚Rothmaler‘ (Jäger 2011) as a taxonomic standard list.

Phlogeny, Evolution and Biogeography of subfamily Pitcairnioideae s.str. (Bromeliaceae)
Archived project
The scope of this project is to investigate the evolution, biogeography and phylogenetic relationships of the five genera of subfamily Pitcairnioideae s.str. (Bromeliaceae), namely genera Deuterocohnia, Dyckia, Encholirium, Fosterella, and Pitcairnia. The subdivision into a mesic and xeric clade as well as the differences in species numbers makes them an interesting group to studiy speciation in South America.
